intro: Cerastium kochii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It is often found in high-altitude meadows and can tolerate harsh weather conditions. Cerastium kochii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in difficult growing conditions.
